means: 呼，喊，叫( shout的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He shouted at his brother, his neck veins bulging.
sentence.Network_cn: 他朝他的兄弟吼叫，脖子上青筋暴突。

sentence.Network_en: He charged into the crowd. "Break it up," he shouted.
sentence.Network_cn: 他冲进人群，大喊道：“散开。”

sentence.Network_en: He had shouted down the phone at her, beside himself with anxiety.
sentence.Network_cn: 他焦急万分地对着电话那头的她大喊大叫。

PerfectNetExp.abs: shouted another , and they all lay flat on their faces ., 另一喊道 . 他们都脸朝下趴在地上.
the slave catcher shouted : " Stop , you Negro . "抓逃跑奴隶的人大声喊道:"站住，你这黑鬼。"
O. K. Harold shouted , wishing he could punch the rosy , soft face ,“对，”哈罗德嚷道，希望他能挥拳猛击那张红润柔软的脸，
Trish turned and shouted in the direction of the library . " Katherine ? I think you'll want to see this ! " "特蕾丝转过身来，朝着图书馆方向大喊道：“凯瑟琳？我觉得你肯定想看看这个！”

list.abs: ...识我们了，多丢人啊……”老徐说，每次儿子一发狂就会破口大骂（shout abuse），所以他们不得已搬到这里来住，至少这里安静些…
初中英语词组大全 - 豆丁网 ... knock at 敲(门、窗) 24) shout at 对……大喊(嚷) 25) throw away 扔掉 26).
get into 进入shout at 训斥、责备What happen？ 发生什么事了？.
吆_百度百科 ... [cry out] 吆喝呼喊 [call;shout to] 呼唤 [loudly urge an animal] 大声驱赶；大声趋逐.
介词（主要是to）的用法_爱问知识人 ... say to 告知, shout to 对某人大叫, suggest to 对某人提建议.
包含骂的词语 | 常用词典 | 中华博物 ... ◆ 毒骂[  curse viciously ] ◆ 叫骂[ shout curses ] ◆ 滥骂[  scurrility ].

entry.tran: (通常指生气时或希望远方的人能听见时而)大叫，嚷，高呼
entry.def: If you shout, you say something very loudly, usually because you want people a long distance away to hear you or because you are angry.

example.ex: He had to shout to make himself heard above the near gale-force wind...
example.tran: 在呼啸的大风中他得大声喊叫才能让别人听见。
“她还活着!”他欢欣鼓舞地大声叫道。

entry.tran: 成功在望;有成功的机会
entry.def: If you say that someone is in with a shout of achieving or winning something, you mean that they have a chance of achieving or winning it.

example.ex: He knew he was in with a shout of making Craig Brown's squad for Japan.
example.tran: 他明白自己有望为日本建成克雷格·布朗之队。

entry.def: If you are in a pub and someone you are with says 'It's your shout' or 'It's my shout', they mean that it is your turn or their turn to buy a round of drinks.

sentences.sentence: "his shouted words of encouragement could be heard over the crowd noises"

Sentence.sentence: She isn't going to be shouted down by over-confident young gentlemen.
